      • ComponentWrapper

        public ComponentWrapper(java.lang.String pluginNameIn,
                        java.lang.String instanceNameIn,
                        ComponentCache componentCacheIn,
                        MaskingComponent componentIn,
                        MaskingLogService.MaskingLogServiceConfig maskingLogServiceConfig)
        Create a wrapper for a top level component
        Parameters:
        pluginNameIn - The name of the plugin
        instanceNameIn - The name of the component instance
        componentCacheIn - The component caching loader
        componentIn - The component being wrapped
        maskingLogServiceConfig - A MaskingLogService.MaskingLogServiceConfig object for The configuration of the logger.

    • Method Detail

      • setupComponentIfNeeded

        public MaskingComponent setupComponentIfNeeded()
        Set up the wrapped component only if needed. To ensure the component is always ready before use, use this method to get a reference to the wrapped component.
        Returns:
        The component managed by this wrapper

      • getUnreadyComponent

        public MaskingComponent getUnreadyComponent()
        Get the component without calling setup. Useful for getting information about a component without doing the work to fully initialize it.
        Returns:
        The potentially not-yet initialized component managed by this wrapper

      • cleanupComponent

        public void cleanupComponent()
        Initiate cleanup on this component and any closeables opened by this wrapper for the component.

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws ComponentConfigurationException
        Throws:
        ComponentConfigurationException

      • getInstanceName

        public java.lang.String getInstanceName()
        Get the name of this component instance. For algorithms, this corresponds to algorithmName in the Masking API and algorithmCd.
        Specified by:
        getInstanceName in interface ComponentService
        Returns:
        The name of the instance

      • checkComponentDependencies

        public void checkComponentDependencies(boolean isExternalAllowed)
        Recursively check all component dependencies referenced directly or indirectly by the wrapped component. Verify that all dependencies exist and that the dependency graph is free of cycles. Dependencies on resources not defined as MaskingComponents in this API are not checked.
        Parameters:
        isExternalAllowed - Whether dependencies may exist outside of the plugin that provided the component
        Throws:
        InvalidDependencyException - When a dependency is invalid or would result in a dependency loop
        MissingDependencyException - When a dependency is missing

      • openJdbcConnection

        public java.sql.Connection openJdbcConnection(@Nonnull
                                              JdbcReference jdbcReference)
        Description copied from interface: ComponentService
        Method to open a JDBC resource. The resulting Connection remains valid for the life of the calling MaskingAlgorithm object, but may be closed be when no longer needed to free resources.
        Specified by:
        openJdbcConnection in interface ComponentService
        Parameters:
        jdbcReference - A JdbcReference object to provide the jdbc connection information.
        Returns:
        A Connection object.

      • openInputFile

        public java.io.InputStream openInputFile(@Nonnull
                                         FileReference fileRef)
        Description copied from interface: ComponentService
        Method to open a file resource by URI. The resulting InputStream remains valid for the life of the calling MaskingAlgorithm object, but may be closed be when no longer needed to free resources.
        Specified by:
        openInputFile in interface ComponentService
        Parameters:
        fileRef - A reference to the file to be opened.
        Returns:
        An InputStream for the desired file

      • getAlgorithmByName

        public <U> MaskingAlgorithm<U> getAlgorithmByName(@Nonnull
                                                  AlgorithmInstanceReference algorithmReference,
                                                  @Nonnull
                                                  MaskingAlgorithm.MaskingType type)
        Description copied from interface: ComponentService
        Get a MaskingAlgorithm object for the algorithm specified by the reference and type. It is only possible to find named instances of component algorithms using this method. The returned MaskingAlgorithm object is fully initialized and ready to mask data.
        Specified by:
        getAlgorithmByName in interface ComponentService
        Type Parameters:
        U - The data type masked by the returned algorithm, must exactly match what is requested in type
        Parameters:
        algorithmReference - A reference describing the algorithm instance to get
        type - The masking data type the named algorithm is expected mask
        Returns:
        A masking algorithm object

      • getCryptoService

        public CryptoService getCryptoService(KeyReference reference)
        This implements the ComponentService method that provides access to the algorithm's key wrapped by the CryptoServiceImpl, which implements a number of cryptographic functions using that key.
        Specified by:
        getCryptoService in interface ComponentService
        Parameters:
        reference - A reference to the key to use. Currently, the reference value must be "", referring to the default algorithm key assigned to this algorithm.
        Returns:
        The service object wrapping the algorithm's key

      • getLogService

        public LogService getLogService()
        Description copied from interface: ComponentService
        Get a Logger object that can be used to log messages. The logger has a rate limitter that can be configured in the Masking engine. The rate limitter controls the number of bytes per second. Attention! The sensitive (not masked) information should never be logged!
        Specified by:
        getLogService in interface ComponentService
        Returns:
        The MaskingLogService object.

      • getPluginName

        public java.lang.String getPluginName()
